nodes.name: aggregate at customer
nodes.description: This node runs the given SQL on the incoming DataFrame
nodes.details:
This node receives an input data frame, creates a temporary table on top of that data frame.
Allows the user to write a SQL which would be executed on the temporary table.
The resulting data frame of running the SQL is passed on to the next node.
nodes.examples:
SQL Examples


Below are some example of SQL.

They use the Temp Table Name to be : tempTable

The schem of the Input Dataframe is : id, price, lotsize, bedrooms, bathrms, stories, driveway, recroom, fullbase, gashw, airco, garagepl, prefarea

avg price of house


select avg(price) as avg_price from tempTable


bedrooms with avg price greater than 10000


select bedrooms, avg_price from
(select bedrooms, avg(price) as avg_price from tempTable group by bedrooms) as temp where avg_price > 10000


house details with bedrooms avg price greater than 10000


select tempTable.* , inner_table.avg_price from
(select bedrooms, avg_price from
(select bedrooms, avg(price) as avg_price from tempTable group by bedrooms) as temp where avg_price > 10000) as inner_table
JOIN tempTable ON(inner_table.bedrooms = tempTable.bedrooms)
nodes.hint: Whenever the table is changed, go to Schema tab and Refresh the Schema

fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: tempTable
fields.title: Temp Table
fields.description: Temp Table Name to be used

fields.name: sql
fields.value:
select CustomerID, 
count(*) as num_cards,  
concat_ws(',',collect_list(Type)) as CardTypes,
concat_ws(',',collect_list(Limit)) as CardLimits
from fire_temp_table group by  CustomerID
fields.title: SQL
fields.description: SQL to be run

nodes.name: flag transactions
nodes.description: This node runs the given SQL on the incoming DataFrame
nodes.details:
This node receives an input data frame, creates a temporary table on top of that data frame.
Allows the user to write a SQL which would be executed on the temporary table.
The resulting data frame of running the SQL is passed on to the next node.
nodes.examples:
SQL Examples


Below are some example of SQL.

They use the Temp Table Name to be : tempTable

The schem of the Input Dataframe is : id, price, lotsize, bedrooms, bathrms, stories, driveway, recroom, fullbase, gashw, airco, garagepl, prefarea

avg price of house


select avg(price) as avg_price from tempTable


bedrooms with avg price greater than 10000


select bedrooms, avg_price from
(select bedrooms, avg(price) as avg_price from tempTable group by bedrooms) as temp where avg_price > 10000


house details with bedrooms avg price greater than 10000


select tempTable.* , inner_table.avg_price from
(select bedrooms, avg_price from
(select bedrooms, avg(price) as avg_price from tempTable group by bedrooms) as temp where avg_price > 10000) as inner_table
JOIN tempTable ON(inner_table.bedrooms = tempTable.bedrooms)

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: tempTable
fields.title: Temp Table
fields.description: Temp Table Name to be used

fields.name: sql
fields.value:
select CustomerID, TrxAmount, TrxDate, TrxType,
case when (datediff(to_date('2016-06-30'), TrxDate) <= 30) then 1 else 0 end as last_30_days_transaction_flag,
case when (datediff(to_date('2016-06-30'), TrxDate) <= 60) then 1 else 0 end as last_60_days_transaction_flag,
case when (datediff(to_date('2016-06-30'), TrxDate) <= 90) then 1 else 0 end as last_90_days_transaction_flag
from fire_temp_table
fields.title: SQL
fields.description: SQL to be run

nodes.name: aggregation
nodes.description: This node runs the given SQL on the incoming DataFrame
nodes.details:
This node receives an input data frame, creates a temporary table on top of that data frame.
Allows the user to write a SQL which would be executed on the temporary table.
The resulting data frame of running the SQL is passed on to the next node.
nodes.examples:
SQL Examples


Below are some example of SQL.

They use the Temp Table Name to be : tempTable

The schem of the Input Dataframe is : id, price, lotsize, bedrooms, bathrms, stories, driveway, recroom, fullbase, gashw, airco, garagepl, prefarea

avg price of house


select avg(price) as avg_price from tempTable


bedrooms with avg price greater than 10000


select bedrooms, avg_price from
(select bedrooms, avg(price) as avg_price from tempTable group by bedrooms) as temp where avg_price > 10000


house details with bedrooms avg price greater than 10000


select tempTable.* , inner_table.avg_price from
(select bedrooms, avg_price from
(select bedrooms, avg(price) as avg_price from tempTable group by bedrooms) as temp where avg_price > 10000) as inner_table
JOIN tempTable ON(inner_table.bedrooms = tempTable.bedrooms)
nodes.hint: Whenever the table is changed, go to Schema tab and Refresh the Schema

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: tempTable
fields.title: Temp Table
fields.description: Temp Table Name to be used

fields.name: sql
fields.value:
select temp.CustomerID, total_tx_amount, total_num_transaction, NumTransTypes,
last_30_days_tx_amount, last_30_days_transaction, 
last_60_days_tx_amount, last_60_days_transaction,
last_90_days_tx_amount,last_90_days_transaction,
last_txt_date, first_txt_date,
case when last_txt_date == first_txt_date and first_txt_date >= to_date('2016-06-01') then 1
else 0 end as isNewCustomer
from
(select CustomerID, sum(TrxAmount) as total_tx_amount, count(*) as total_num_transaction, count(distinct TrxType) as NumTransTypes
from fire_temp_table1 group by CustomerID)temp
LEFT OUTER JOIN 
(select CustomerID, sum(TrxAmount) as last_30_days_tx_amount, sum(last_30_days_transaction_flag) as last_30_days_transaction
from fire_temp_table1 where last_30_days_transaction_flag = 1 group by CustomerID)temp_30
ON(temp.CustomerID = temp_30.CustomerID)
LEFT OUTER JOIN 
(select CustomerID, sum(TrxAmount) as last_60_days_tx_amount, sum(last_60_days_transaction_flag) as last_60_days_transaction
from fire_temp_table1 where last_60_days_transaction_flag = 1 group by CustomerID)temp_60
ON(temp_30.CustomerID = temp_60.CustomerID)
LEFT OUTER JOIN 
(select CustomerID, sum(TrxAmount) as last_90_days_tx_amount, sum(last_90_days_transaction_flag) as last_90_days_transaction
from fire_temp_table1 where last_90_days_transaction_flag = 1 group by CustomerID)temp_90
ON(temp_60.CustomerID = temp_90.CustomerID)
LEFT OUTER JOIN
(select CustomerID, max(TrxDate) as last_txt_date, min(TrxDate) as first_txt_date from fire_temp_table1 group by CustomerID)temp1
ON(temp_60.CustomerID = temp1.CustomerID)
fields.title: SQL
fields.description: SQL to be run
